revised_title: Vaccinia Virus Cultivation in Cell-Free Medium: A New Series of Subcultures
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to cultivate vaccinia virus in a cell-free medium, demonstrating its ability to multiply without living cells. They found that the virus could survive and increase in a medium containing rabbit kidney extract, even after being treated with hypertonic saline and frozen and thawed. This study contributes to the understanding of virus growth requirements and challenges previous criticisms of cell-free virus cultivation.
